lines.text: What's the matter honey?
When you going to let me feel grown up?
Letting you go out with Bubbles and every one of her men friends? Will that make you feel grown up?
I"m sick of the idea of not being able to go anywhere, do anything, without the written consent of my Mother. I'm tired of being treated like a child. I'm going to bed.
I wonder why my girdle's getting so small?
Maybe you're crowding too much into it.
I got a date with a cab driver.
Yeah? Where're you going?
Who's going? We're parking.
There's no business like show business.
He says to me, "I'd like to see your show, baby, how 'bout a couple of passes?"
Nerve! The guys I go out with don't want passes, they just make 'em.
Speaking of passes, I've been knocking so many lately I feel like an All-American.
I'm quitin'! Right now! This minute, see! This turkey can fold for all I care.
Okay, okay! A fine thing, fightin' like a couple of alley cats! What are you trying to do? Give Burlesque a bad name?
Peggy doesn't belong in your world. She belongs in the show world - burlesque. Burlesque Queen - that's what people call her.
What difference does that make?
You don't care. But, what about your mother? And your friends? What will they say when you bring a burlesque girl home and you introduce her as your wife?
They better say its wonderful.
Mrs. Martin, I hope you'll forgive me for saying this, but, you have a Mother complex.
You know, you're never too old to do what you did.
